greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Take n in binary. Rotate the binary digits to the right until a 1 once again appears as the leftmost digit. Convert back into decimal for a(n).
comment: This sequence written in binary is A139707.
This is a permutation of the positive integers. A139708 is the inverse permutation.
Moreover, the first 2^n terms are a permutation of the first 2^n positive integers. Fixed points of the permutation are A272919. - _Ivan Neretin_, May 10 2016
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
maple: A139706 := proc(n) local a; a := ListTools[Rotate](convert(n,base,2),1) ; while op(-1,a) = 0 do a := ListTools[Rotate](a,1) ; od: add(op(i,a)*2^(i-1),i=1..nops(a)) : end: seq(A139706(n),n=1..100) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, May 04 2008
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 30 2008
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, May 04 2008
